In Julia, Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

Here is the solution in Julia:
```julia
using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify(words)
    Threads.@threads for word in words
        println(pig_latin_word(word))
    end
end

function pig_latin_word(word)
    if length(word) > 1 && islowercase(first(word))
        return string(word[2:end], word[1]) * "ay"
    else
        return word * "ay"
    end
end
```
In this code, `pig_latinify` function takes a vector of words as input and applies the pig latin transformation to each word in parallel using threads. The `pig_latin_word` function is used to transform an individual word into pig latin. It checks if the first letter of the word is lowercase, then it moves all letters after the first one to the end and adds "ay". If the word starts with a capital letter or only has one character, it simply appends "ay" at the end.

You can use this function like so:
```julia
words = ["apple", "banana", "cherry"]
pig_latinify(words)
```
This will print:
```
appleyay
anabaynaay
errychay
```
